com.netflix.genie.client

Class ExecutionServiceClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.genie.client.BaseGenieClient
      • com.netflix.genie.client.ExecutionServiceClient

  • public final class ExecutionServiceClient
extends BaseGenieClient
    Singleton class, which acts as the client library for the Genie Execution Service.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.netflix.genie.client.BaseGenieClient

        NIWS_APP_NAME_GENIE, NIWS_CLIENT_NAME_GENIE

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ExecutionServiceClient getInstance()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the singleton instance that can be used by clients.
        Returns:
        ExecutionServiceClient instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error instantiating client

      • submitJob

        public JobInfoElement submitJob(JobInfoElement jobInfo)
                         throws CloudServiceException
        Submits a job using given parameters.
        Parameters:
        jobInfo - for submitting job (can't be null)
        jobInfo.userName not null - required
        jobInfo.userAgent optional, e.g. UC4, search, etc (however client wishes to categorize themselves)
        jobInfo.jobName optional - job name to be used
        jobInfo.jobID optional - will be auto-generated if it is null
        jobInfo.jobType required - HADOOP, HIVE or PIG
        jobInfo.configuration required for HIVE, PIG - PROD or TEST
        jobInfo.schedule required - ADHOC or SCHEDULED
        jobInfo.cmdArgs required - command-line arguments
        jobInfo.fileDependencies optional - file dependencies in S3, represented as a CSV
        More details can be found on the Genie User Guide on GitHub.
        Returns:
        updated jobInfo for submitted job, if there is no error
        Throws:
        CloudServiceException

      • getJob

        public JobInfoElement getJob(java.lang.String jobID)
                      throws CloudServiceException
        Gets job information for a given jobID.
        Parameters:
        jobID - the Genie jobID (can't be null)
        Returns:
        the jobInfo for this jobID
        Throws:
        CloudServiceException

      • getJobs

        public JobInfoElement[] getJobs(com.google.common.collect.Multimap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
                         throws CloudServiceException
        Gets a set of jobs for the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - key/value pairs in a map object.
        More details on the parameters can be found on the Genie User Guide on GitHub.
        Returns:
        array of jobInfos that match the filter
        Throws:
        CloudServiceException

      • waitForCompletion

        public JobInfoElement waitForCompletion(java.lang.String jobID,
                               long blockTimeout)
                                 throws CloudServiceException,
                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for job to complete, until the given timeout.
        Parameters:
        jobID - the Genie job ID to wait for completion
        blockTimeout - the time to block for (in ms), after which a CloudServiceException will be thrown
        Returns:
        the jobInfo for the job after completion
        Throws:
        CloudServiceException - on service errors
        java.lang.InterruptedException - on timeout/thread errors

      • waitForCompletion

        public JobInfoElement waitForCompletion(java.lang.String jobID,
                               long blockTimeout,
                               long pollTime)
                                 throws CloudServiceException,
                                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for job to complete, until the given timeout.
        Parameters:
        jobID - the Genie job ID to wait for completion
        blockTimeout - the time to block for (in ms), after which a CloudServiceException will be thrown
        pollTime - the time to sleep between polling for job status
        Returns:
        the jobInfo for the job after completion
        Throws:
        CloudServiceException - on service errors
        java.lang.InterruptedException - on timeout/thread errors

      • killJob

        public JobStatusResponse killJob(java.lang.String jobID)
                          throws CloudServiceException
        Kill a job using its jobID.
        Parameters:
        jobID - the Genie jobID for the job to kill
        Returns:
        the final job status for this job
        Throws:
        CloudServiceException
